Article Title: We stole our smooch from apes from 21mn years ago
Article Text: BENGALURU: If you think kissing is only about human romance, you’re already missing the story. The first kiss happened long before humans walked the Earth—somewhere in the misty forests of prehistoric Africa, between two ape ancestors, 16.9-21.5 million years ago.As per a new evolutionary study, a kiss is better understood as an ancient, risky mouth-to-mouth gamble that large apes, and probably Neanderthals, started playing millions of years ago. And instead of asking what a kiss means, researchers went after a tougher question: why this odd, germ-sharing behaviour evolved at all in the first place.Researchers from University of Oxford, University College London, and the Florida Institute of Technology began by stripping the sentimentality out of kissing and giving it a cross-species definition: non-aggressive, mouth-to-mouth contact within a species, with some lip or mouth movement and no food transfer.That rules out feeding, “kiss-fighting” and your dog licking your face, but includes everything from human deep kisses to brief pecks between monkeys and apes. As per this definition, they found that kissing occurs in taxa as diverse as ants, birds, and polar bears, but the majority of reports seem to be in the primates.Using this, they sifted through decades of primate fieldwork and video material to classify each Afro-Eurasian monkey and ape species as “kissing observed” or “not observed”.They then mapped the data onto a primate family tree and used statistical methods to estimate when kissing first appeared. Their findings: proper lip-to-lip contact predates humans by a vast margin. The behaviour likely evolved in the common ancestor we share with chimpanzees, bonobos and orangutans, making every romantic clinch a faint genetic echo from deep time.The research, published in Evolution and Human Behavior, also indicates an 84% chance that Neanderthals kissed. It is even possible they kissed modern humans during the period both species coexisted. The clue lies in shared oral microbes that could only have been passed through close mouth-to-mouth contact.Why Kiss At All?Kissing poses an evolutionary puzzle because it offers no obvious survival benefit, while the risk of disease transfer is high. Matilda Brindle from University of Oxford and her colleagues wanted to know why animals persist with it. Using primates, the only group where kissing is well-documented, they traced its evolutionary path.The behaviour appears in most great apes and at least eight Old World monkey species. Gorillas do it, though infrequently. Bonobos engage in what researchers call “prolonged tongue-tongue interaction”. Chimpanzees opt for brief, tense kisses, usually after confrontations.So why kiss at all? Leading explanations suggest it may help assess a mate’s health, increase arousal, strengthen social bonds or even transfer beneficial microbes. The study hints that species with several mating partners are more likely to kiss, pointing to a role in sexual selection.Yet kissing is not universal among humans. It is absent in some societies, raising the possibility of cultural learning rather than pure instinct.The researchers note that scientific records of kissing are sparse because the behaviour is often dismissed as trivial. Still, they argue that their framework offers a starting point for understanding a habit so common that we rarely question it.Next time you kiss someone, remember: you’re participating in a ritual older than us, refined across millions of years of primate evolution. Though whether that makes it more or less romantic is anyone’s guess.
Article Summary: Kissing predates humans by a vast margin. The behaviour likely evolved in the common ancestor we share with chimpanzees, bonobos and orangutans. Leading explanations suggest it may help assess a mate’s health, increase arousal, strengthen social bonds or even transfer beneficial microbes.

Article Title: Indian, Nasa experts confirm 3I/ATLAS is a ‘comet’, rule out ‘alien ship’ theory
Article Text: Indian and Nasa space scientists have captured fresh images of interstellar object 3I/ATLAS and confirmed that it has all the characteristics of a “comet” while dismissing some astronomers’ theory that it could be an “alien ship”.The scientists from Ahmedabad-based Physical Research Laboratory (PRL) under the Department of Space have captured interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, which is currently on its way out of the inner solar system, Isro said in a statement on Wednesday. PRL scientists observed 3I/ATLAS in imaging and spectroscopic modes with the 1.2-metre telescope, located at an altitude of 1,680 metre in Mount Abu. PRL made these observations between Nov 12 and 15.On Wednesday, Nasa also released fresh images of 3I/ATLAS and dismissed speculation that it is an alien spacecraft. “It definitely behaves like a comet. We certainly haven't seen any technosignatures or anything from it that would lead us to believe it was anything other than a comet,” Nicola Fox, associate administrator of Nasa's science mission directorate, said, while referring to the comet as “our friendly solar system visitor”.Fox said Nasa has studied 3I/ATLAS with over a dozen scientific platforms, including Hubble and James Webb space telescopes and satellites orbiting Mars.NASA associate administrator Amit Kshatriya also said, “It looks and behaves like a comet. And all evidence points to it being a comet.” The new Nasa images showed it with a blurry appearance but with the clear presence of a telltale coma — the hazy cloud of gas and dust around its nucleus — and the tail of dust following its orbit.According to Indian scientists, the images of PRL observation show a near-circular coma. The coma of a comet is the large, glowing atmosphere of gas and dust that forms around its nucleus as it gets closer to the Sun. It is created when the Sun's heat causes the frozen ices on the nucleus to vaporise, or ‘sublimate’, releasing gas and dust that form a large, diffused cloud. Indian scientists have also acquired a spectrum of the light from the comet. The result shows prominent emission features commonly seen in solar system comets — CN, C2 and C3 bands in the shorter wavelength side of the spectrum, the Isro statement said.In case of 3I/ATLAS, the production rates for the prominent bands (emissions pertaining to the constituent molecules) were computed with limiting values around 1025 molecules/sec. The production rate ratios seem to place this comet in the class of ‘typical comets’ of the solar system. Further observations will be continued as the comet gradually comes into the darker part of the night, it said.
Article Summary: Indian and nasa space scientists have captured fresh images of interstellar object 3i/atlas. Indian scientists have also acquired a spectrum of the light from the comet. The result shows prominent emission features commonly seen in solar system comets. Further observations will be continued as the comet gradually comes into the darker part of the night.

Article Title: Stephen Curry’s wife achieves another milestone with nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards
Article Text:
Image via Getty

Ayesha Curry ’s Sweet July Skin gets nominated for Best Category Launch

Image via Ayesha Curry/Instagram (screengrab)

Also Read:

Stephen Curry’s wife achieves another milestone. Her brand, Sweet July Skin, got nominated under the category of Best Category Launch for its Lip Treatment Launch at the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards. Ayesha announced about the treatment earlier this year and it was later launched on July 12, 2025. It comes in three different flavors - Guava Jelly, Lychee Jelly and Essential. The product has been a huge success and positive reviews have dropped in.This is not the first time Sweet July Skin has been nominated. Their products have won awards before and seem like their new ones are getting the same kind of positive reviews from the users. Other launches that got nominated in the category are - Glow Recipe, Goddess Maintenance Co. - Launch of BioTech Blowout, Lisa Eldridge Pinpoint - Concealer Micro Correcting Pencil, Luna Bronze Self Tanning Jelly and POV Beauty.The nomination filing for the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards closed on October 10, 2025. Shortly after, on November 19, the media brand Glossy announced the finalists for this year’s edition. Ayesha Curry’s Sweet July Skin got nominated under the category of Best Category Launch. Daniel Iturbe from Sweet July Skin announced the happy news on her Instagram story, tagging both Ayesha and the media brand Glossy. Ayesha later reposted the story on her Instagram.Daniel wrote, “@sweetjuly is a finalist for best launch. Big congrats to @ayeshacurry and team!! Thank you @glossyco.”Ayesha’s brand has been achieving accolades since its launch. Their product, Irie Power Face Oil, is an award-winning one. It won the “Best Clarifying Face Oil” award at the 2024 NewBeauty Beauty Awards. Up until now, their lip treatment has also been receiving positive reviews from users. The launch of this treatment was widely planned. While Ayesha announced the launch towards the beginning of July, the party was attended by several celebrities, including her husband, Stephen Curry. Ayesha even collaborated with Garden Creamery. It is a popular ice cream shop that specializes in Asian fruit Sorbets. The collaboration resulted in the production of ice creams in the flavor of the lip treatment. It was a perfect move to bring the tropical motif to life.While the launch was so huge and widely planned, the nomination was well deserved. The winners of the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards will be announced on December 2, 2025.
Article Summary: Ayesha curry’s sweet july skin got nominated under the category of best category launch at the 2025 glossy beauty and wellness awards. Ayesha announced about the treatment earlier this year and it was later launched on july 12, 2025. It comes in three different flavors - guava jelly, lychee jelly and essential.

Article Title: Apple AirPods Pro 3 available with $30 discount in Black Friday deal on Amazon US
Article Text:
Feature



Details





Design & Fit



Smaller earbuds for a better fit; Apple analysed tens of thousands of ears; includes five sizes of ear tips; foam-infused tips; rated IP57 for sweat and water resistance; Apple calls them the "best fitting AirPods ever."





Sound & Noise Cancellation



Redesigned airflow system that widens the sound stage; foam-infused ear tips help double the noise cancellation compared to the previous AirPods Pro; Apple describes the difference as "night-and-day" vs the 2019 model.





Heart Sensor & Health Tracking



New heart sensor using custom PPG tech that “shines invisible infrared light pulsed at 256 times per second”; tracks heart rate, calories burned, and activity when paired with other AirPods sensors (accelerometer, gyroscope, GPS); supports up to 50 workouts; data visible in Fitness app.





Apple Intelligence Features



Works with Workout Buddy (iOS 26); supports Live Translation, lowering ANC volume to ensure precise translations; improved Transparency mode; live transcription displayed horizontally on iPhone.
Article Summary: New heart sensor uses custom ppg tech that “shines invisible infrared light pulsed at 256 times per second” tracks heart rate, calories burned, and activity when paired with other airpods sensors. Works with workout buddy (ios 26); supports live translation, lowering anc volume to ensure precise translations.

Article Title: Adin Ross causes storm online after announcing Nick Fuentes recognition in major event with Zack Asmongold
Article Text:
Adin Ross causes storm online after announcing Nick Fuentes recognition in major event with Zack Asmongold (Image Via Getty)

Adin Ross teams up with Zack Asmongold and Nick Lee after Ed Craven ends support





Adin Ross shocked many viewers on November 19, 2025, when he revealed during his Just Chatting livestream that he is planning a new “real” streamer awards show. The short 26-second clip from his stream was posted on X later the same day. In the clip, he said he is teaming up with Zack “Asmongold” and Nick Lee, who is the husband of Kaitlyn “Amouranth,” to create an event that will honor online creators in a different way.He also said something that grabbed even more attention. Adin Ross told his chat that controversial internet figure Nick Fuentes “deserves a f**king award.” He said the awards will not be biased and will not follow the usual pattern of “LA friends” picking each other. He told viewers he wants awards to go to people who “actually deserve awards,” and he wants the event to feel honest and direct.During his November 19, 2025 livestream, Adin Ross explained why he chose to work with Nick Lee and Zack Asmongold. He said he wants a simple and fair event on Kick that gives creators real recognition.He told viewers, “Chat, I’m going to team up with Amouranth’s husband and Asmongold to put on the Kick awards show… We’re going to do streamer awards, and we’re going to do real awards.”He then added, “Nick Fuentes deserves a fking award.”**Two days earlier, on November 17, 2025, Adin Ross had already shared that the first version of the awards show fell apart.He said Kick CEO Ed Craven pulled out of funding the project. Adin Ross explained that the event would cost a lot of money, and he could not pay for everything himself.He told his chat, “Eddie does not want to cover the Kick award stuff anymore. So we are not doing my version of it anymore.”After the funding problem, Nick Lee reached out and offered to support the event, but only if Adin Ross agreed to host and if they considered adding Ice Poseidon.Adin Ross said he was open to making it work with Nick Lee. The new plan is to create a fresh awards show under Kick but with their own rules and choices.As of now, Zack Asmongold has not posted any public response about his involvement in the event.Fans are waiting to see how the three creators will shape the show and whether Nick Fuentes will actually be included in the nominations.Also Read: QTCinderella Faces Backlash After Jasontheween Nomination Clips Spark Criticism From XQc And Asmongold
Article Summary: Adin ross said he is teaming up with zack asmongold and nick lee to create an event that will honor online creators in a different way. He told viewers he wants awards to go to people who “actually deserve awards,” and he wants the event to feel honest and direct.

Article Title: Roblox implements new age verification for chat features: What the new facial age checks mean for kids, parents and moderators
Article Text:
Roblox implements new age verification for chat features

New Roblox rules : Age verification required for chat features



Roblox chat age checks start in select countries in December



How Roblox’s facial age-estimation technology estimates your age



Who can chat with whom on Roblox: Age brackets and rules



Roblox’s privacy and safety: New policies for chat and moderation



Why Roblox says it is doing this now



Related FAQs for parents and users



Do children lose all chat features?

Children under 13 will be restricted from most chats with adults and older teens by default; under-9 chat is off unless a parent consents after verification. Peer-to-peer chat among similar-aged users remains possible depending on the age bracket.

What if the age check is wrong?

Roblox says users can appeal an age estimate by providing a government ID or obtaining parental verification; the company has described a 48-hour window to verify if someone believes they were misclassified. Reported flows vary by market.

Will the selfie or ID be stored?

Roblox has stated that the selfie used for age estimation will not be stored; the company also offers ID-based verification, wherea government ID is submitted and processed under privacy safeguards. Independent privacy reviews have been requested by advocates.

Are private chats still monitored?

Yes, Roblox currently does not use end-to-end encryption for private chats, enabling automated and human moderation to detect abuse and policy violations. The company says this monitoring will continue and is a key part of its safety controls.





Roblox, the global online game and social platform with more than 150 million daily users, has announced a major update to how users can communicate: a new age-based chat system that uses facial age-estimation and other age-verification methods to limit conversations between children and much older users. The company says the change prompted by lawsuits and growing scrutiny of child safety online will place users into narrow age cohorts (for example: under 9, 9–12, 13–15, 16–17, 18–20 and 21+) and block most cross-age private chats unless specific trust or parental-consent steps are taken. Roblox frames the move as a new industry safety standard and plans a phased rollout starting in December 2025 (pilot markets) with global enforcement in January 2026. The following article explains what Roblox will do, how the technology works, what alternatives exist, and what experts, advocates and parents have said so far, strictly reporting facts and official claims with up-to-date sourcing.Roblox will require users who want to use private messaging and certain chat features to complete an age check. The platform will estimate a user’s age using a live selfie video processed by a third-party age-estimation provider (Persona), or users can verify age with a government ID or parental consent where required.Based on that estimate or verification, Roblox assigns an age bracket and allows chat only with users in the same or nearby brackets. Under-9 accounts will have chat turned off by default unless a parent provides permission after verification. Roblox says images used for the facial check will not be stored.Roblox is starting the new system with a voluntary age-check period immediately and will enforce mandatory age checks in phases. The company has said it will begin the first enforced rollouts in December 2025 in countries including Australia, New Zealand and the Netherlands, followed by a broader, global enforcement in January 2026 for markets where chat features are available. Users will see in-app prompts to verify age; those who decline may lose access to some communication features.Roblox’s public explanation is that the platform will use a vendor-supplied algorithm to estimate age from a short live selfie video. Roblox executives say the system is calibrated to estimate ages roughly between 5 and 25 with an accuracy window of about one to two years; the company also offers alternatives such as uploading a government ID or using parental verification if a user disputes an estimate. The live selfie flow is intended to detect “liveness” (a real person) and to avoid spoofing with photos. Roblox has emphasised that the selfie is analysed and the platform does not retain the raw image, though privacy advocates note that implementation details matter for trust.Roblox will place accounts into defined age buckets (reported examples: under-9, 9–12, 13–15, 16–17, 18–20, 21+). Chat permissions are then limited so younger users cannot initiate or sustain conversations with significantly older users. For example, a pre-teen placed in the 9–12 group would be prevented from privately messaging users assigned to the 18–20 or 21+ cohorts, unless those relationships are converted into “trusted connections” (which require additional verification, such as confirming a real-world relationship). Roblox says the policy aims to reduce the possibility of adults posing as peers to groom minors.Roblox points out that private chats on the platform are not end-to-end encrypted, which means the platform can scan and moderate messages for policy violations; the company says this ability remains essential for child protection. Roblox also says the age checks will be paired with automated detection systems, human moderation and abuse-reporting tools. The policy updates are part of a broader safety push after lawsuits and media reports alleging that predators used the platform to contact minors.Roblox cites a wave of lawsuits and heightened regulatory scrutiny as a reason to strengthen age-assurance and limit adult-minor communications. The company frames the change as setting a new safety standard for interactive platforms, saying the technology and policies aim to reduce opportunities for grooming and exploitation while preserving legitimate social interactions among peers. Roblox’s safety team has published a company statement and blog post describing the rollout and the expected user experience.
Article Summary: Roblox will require users who want to use private messaging and certain chat features to complete an age check. Under-9 accounts will have chat turned off by default unless a parent provides permission after verification. The platform will estimate a user’s age using a live selfie video processed by a third-party age-estimation provider.

Article Title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on H-1B visa: Contribution of immigrants to sector has been nothing but…
Article Text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai lauded immigrants' "phenomenal" role in America's tech prowess amidst President Trump's controversial $100,000 H-1B visa fee. This policy, sparking panic and protests, has prompted debate on its impact on innovation. While some, like Netflix's Reed Hastings, see it as a solution for high-value jobs, others, including Nvidia's Jensen Huang, warn it could drive talent abroad. The legislation's potential to reshape the tech talent pipeline, particularly for Indian professionals, remains a significant concern.
Article Summary: Google ceo sundar pichai lauded immigrants' "phenomenal" role in america's tech prowess. President trump's controversial $100,000 h-1b visa fee has prompted debate on its impact on innovation. Some, like netflix's reed hastings, see it as a solution for high-value jobs. Others, including nvidia's jensen huang, warn it could drive talent abroad.

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang talks about the biggest fear everyone has about AI companies: From our point...
Article Text:
Jensen Huang’s talks about transformative shifts driving AI growth





Nvidia H20 Chips for China: What’s Really Going On?

Record earnings









Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has dismissed the growing concerns about an AI bubble. In recent months, investors and analysts have raised alarms about a potential AI bubble, warning that soaring spending by cloud providers and tech giants may prove unsustainable. Concerns have centered on whether the rapid build-out of AI infrastructure could mirror past boom-and-bust cycles in technology. Huang feels that the industry is presently undergoing some structural transformations and that it will sustain growth for the years to come. Speaking at the company’s earnings call, Huang said, “There’s been a lot of talk about an AI bubble. From our vantage point, we see something very different.” The remarks made by Huang in AI bubble were quite expected as his company is presently at the centre of the artificial intelligence boom. Almost all the major cloud service provider such as Google, Amazon, Oracle are Nvidia’s customers.During the earnings call, Huang also laid down three major transitions which are fueling the demand for Nvidia’s GPUs.- From CPUs to GPUs - Firstly, Huang talked about the slow down of Moore’s law.He said that traditional computing is built around central processors and it is reaching its limit. Industries ranging from data processing to search and ad recommendations are shifting toward GPU-powered systems, which are uniquely suited to handle the massive computational demands of AI.- AI as a creator of new applications - Secondly Huang feels that AI is not just improving the existing tools but it is now unlocking completely new categories of applications. From generative models reshaping search and recommendations to advanced engineering solutions, AI is becoming the foundation for innovations that didn’t exist before.- Rise of Agentic and Physical AI - Lastly, Huang pointed out that the next-generation AI systems are capable of reasoning, planning, and acting and require minimal human intervention. These “agentic” and “physical” AI applications, such as coding assistants and robotics, will require unprecedented levels of computing power, further driving demand for Nvidia’s architecture.Huang believes that Nvidia’s singular architecture supports all three transitions across every industry and modality of AI, making the company uniquely positioned to power this next wave of infrastructure growth.Nvidia reported a record quarter with $57 billion revenue which is up by 62% year-over-year, and forecasted $65 billion for the fourth quarter. The shares of the company rose by 5% in after-hours trading. Nvidia CFO Colette Kress reinforced the bullish outlook, noting, “The clouds are sold out. Our GPU installed base is fully utilized.”
Article Summary: Jensen huang’s talks about transformative shifts driving ai growth. Concerns have centered on whether the rapid build-out of ai infrastructure could mirror past boom-and-bust cycles in technology. Huang feels that the industry is presently undergoing some structural transformations and that it will sustain growth for the years to come.

Article Title: Verizon layoffs: America’s largest telecom company to cut 13,000 jobs, what CEO Dan Schulman said in internal memo
Article Text:
Verizon layoffs 2025

How this compares to Verizon's previous layoffs









: Verizon has announced it will eliminate more than 13,000 positions in what marks the largest single workforce reduction in the telecom company’s history, a report has said, adding that the job cuts come as the country’s largest wireless carrier struggles with competitive pressures and a shrinking customer base. CEO Dan Schulman, who took the helm in October after serving on Verizon’s board since 2018, cited the need to streamline operations and reduce costs that are limiting the company's ability to invest in customer value.“Our current cost structure limits our ability to invest significantly in our customer value proposition," Schulman wrote in an internal memo obtained by news agency Reuters. “We must simplify our operations to address the complexity and friction that slow us down and frustrate our customers”.The telecom giant plans to significantly reduce not only its direct workforce but also outsourced and external labour expenses, the report noted. Additionally, Verizon will convert 179 corporate-owned retail stores into franchised operations and close one location.Meanwhile, a company spokesperson told CNBC that the job cuts are “an opportunity for Verizon to reset, restructure and realign our priorities on ways that will help us regain our leadership as a communications provider.”This represents Verizon's largest-ever single job cut. The company had approximately 1,00,000 US employees at the end of 2024, including around 70,000 non-union workers. Over the previous three years, Verizon had already eliminated nearly 20,000 positions, making the current reduction particularly dramatic.Verizon is establishing a $20 million career transition fund specifically for laid-off workers, focusing on “opportunities and necessary skill sets as we enter the age of AI.” The company emphasised that the job cuts were not driven by AI implementation.Reports say that Verizon is facing competition from established rivals offering cheaper plans and cable operators entering the wireless market. The company added just 44,000 monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the third quarter, significantly trailing AT&T and far behind T-Mobile, which led the industry with over 1 million net subscriber additions.Schulman inherited substantial challenges from his predecessor at PayPal, arriving amid aggressive promotions from AT&T and T-Mobile surrounding new iPhone launches. Despite massive investments—including $52 billion for 5G spectrum in 2021, a $20 billion Frontier Communications acquisition, and $6 billion for TracFone Wireless—Verizon continues to lose ground in the competitive landscape.
Article Summary: Verizon announced it will eliminate more than 13,000 positions in what marks the largest single workforce reduction in the telecom company’s history. Ceo dan schulman cited the need to streamline operations and reduce costs that are limiting the company's ability to invest in customer value.

Article Title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy advocates 72-hour work week; wants young Indians to follow China's banned '996' rule: "No country has progressed without..."
Article Text: Infosys founder N.R. Narayana Murthy has reignited India's work culture debate, advocating for a 72-hour workweek by citing China's controversial '996' schedule. This practice, where employees work 9 AM to 9 PM, six days a week, was declared illegal in China in 2021 due to burnout. Murthy's call has drawn sharp criticism from Indian workers, who point to issues like punishing commutes, rising costs, and the need for competitive salaries over extended hours.
Article Summary: Infosys founder n.r. Narayana murthy has called for a 72-hour workweek. He cited china's controversial '996' schedule, where employees work 9 am to 9 pm, six days a week. This practice was declared illegal in china in 2021 due to burnout.

Article Title: Facebook's former top executive and now OpenAI's CEO of Apps has a 'message' for Mark Zuckerberg: Meta not doing well in …
Article Text:
“I would say the thing that I don’t think we did well at Meta is actually anticipating the risks that our products would create in society.”

“Mental health and jobs were my first two initiatives when I came into the company. I was looking at the landscape and being like, ‘Yep, immediately, mental health is something that we need to address. Jobs are clearly going to face some disruption, and we have a role to play to help minimise that disruption,’”

“That’s not going to be easy, because the path is uncharted. So it is a very big responsibility, but it’s one that I feel like we have both the culture and the prioritisation to really address up-front,”

What Fidji Simo said about OpenAI’s mental health goals



“Just in the span of the last few months, we have massively reduced the prevalence of negative mental health responses. We have launched

parental controls

with leading protections. And we are working on age prediction to protect teens.

At the same time, when you have 800 million people [per week], when we know the prevalence of mental health illnesses in our society, of course, you are going to have people turn to

ChatGPT

during acute distress moments. And doing the right thing every single time is exceptionally hard. So what we’re trying to do is catch as much as we can of the behaviours that are not ideal and then constantly refine our models.

It’s not as if we’re ever going to reach that point where we’re done. Every week, new behaviours emerge with features that we launch where we’re like, ‘Oh, that’s another safety challenge to address.” A good example is mania. You look at the transcripts, and sometimes people say, ‘I feel super great. I haven’t slept in two days, and I feel on top of the world.’ A clinical psychologist would understand that that’s not normal—that’s mania. But if you look at the words, it seems fine. So we work with psychologists to detect the signal that this isn’t someone being super excited, this is a sign of mania, and have a strategy to intervene.

Getting it wrong is also really annoying. If you’re a normal adult, being excited and ChatGPT tells you, ‘Hey, you might be having a manic episode,’ that’s not great. It is a very subtle area, and we’re trying to do it with as much care and as much external input as possible.”





Fidji Simo, the CEO of Apps at ChatGPT-maker OpenAI , has revealed a few shortcomings of her previous employer, Meta. Simo, who was the former Head of the Facebook app at the social media giant, identified that the Mark Zuckerberg-led company failed to do something well: adequately anticipate the societal risks created by its products. In an interview with Wired, Simo stated that this failure is a primary area of focus and responsibility in her new role at the AI firm. She said,However, at OpenAI, she quickly started projects to address these potential problems. Her first two areas of focus are mental health and jobs, as she sees both being changed by AI.Simo explained.Simo also noted that she understands how difficult it is to deal with these issues because there isn't a clear path forward. However, she feels OpenAI is set up to handle this important responsibility.she added.When asked about how she feels OpenAI is doing on mental health right now, Simo said:
Article Summary: Fidji simo, the ceo of apps at chatgpt-maker openai, has revealed a few shortcomings of her previous employer, meta. Simo identified that the mark zuckerberg-led company failed to do something well: adequately anticipate the societal risks created by its products.

Article Title: Google has launched Gemini 3, and why it could be a 'problem' for ChatGPT-maker OpenAI
Article Text:
What makes Gemini 3 different

Pro version available immediately to users and developers.

Day-one integration into Google Search, YouTube, and other apps.

Backed by Google’s full-stack advantage — from research and TPU chips to cloud hosting and consumer-facing platforms.

Dangers Of AI: Is ChatGPT Quietly Harming Your Mental Health? | Global Pulse

Why Gemini 3 could be a problem for OpenAI





The branding battle





Google has launched its latest and most-advanced AI model — Gemini 3. Announcing the new model, Google CEO Sundar Pichai said that the model as “the best model in the world for multimodal understanding. ” As reported by Business Insider, analysts are calling launch of Gemini 3 as the most aggressive move made by Google against OpenAI’s ChatGPT. The launch of Gemini 3 makers a turning point in the AI race, as Google integrates Gemini 3 directly into Google Search from day one, allowing users to access the model instantly via an “AI mode” toggle — no separate app or download required.Google claims that Gemini 3 is the most-advanced model and it is better at coding. The new AI model is more creative and versatile as compared to the previous iterations. However, the real disruption lies in its distribution strategy:This end-to-end control means Google can scale Gemini faster and more efficiently than rivals who rely on external partnerships.OpenAI’s ChatGPT is still one of the most popular AI chatbot globally, but it has a limited ecosystem. It depends on partners for chips, cloud infrastructure, and distribution, whereas Google owns the entire pipeline. Google DeepMind CTO Koray Kavukcuoglu emphasized this edge, “One of the most important things for us at Google is this is possible because we have a very differentiated full-stack approach.” With Gemini 3, Google is positioning itself as not just a competitor, but a direct alternative to ChatGPT across everyday search and productivity tools.Despite Google’s technical dominance, OpenAI still holds a crucial advantage: brand recognition. “ChatGPT” has become shorthand for AI in the public imagination, much like “Google” became synonymous with search.Analysts say Google has time — and money — to change that. With Gemini 3 offered free in some cases, Google could undercut rivals on price and flood the market with its model. Bernstein analyst Mark Schmulik told BI, “There’s no debate that Google has all the technical intangibles across the stack… but we need HARD evidence that they’re putting this all together. With Gemini 3, we may have just gotten some.”Gemini 3 signals Google’s full-throttle entry into the AI arms race, leveraging its infrastructure, apps, and financial muscle to challenge OpenAI’s dominance.
Article Summary: Gemini 3 signals google’s full-throttle entry into the ai arms race, leveraging its infrastructure, apps, and financial muscle. With gemini 3 offered free in some cases, google could undercut rivals on price and flood the market with its model. “chatgpt” has become shorthand for ai in the public imagination.

Article Title: A room full of startup founders and investors at the world's biggest AI conference votes ChatGPT-maker OpenAI among 'likely flops'
Article Text:
Representative Image

Why AI professionals are thinking that OpenAI may turn out to be a ‘flop’





OpenAI's Master Plan for India

"How can a company with $13 billion in revenues make $1.4 trillion of spend commitments?"

"If you want to sell your shares, I'll find you a buyer. Enough,”

"Geeze, it sounds more like the judgmental valley conference."





ChatGPT maker OpenAI was voted among the startups with potential to 'FAIL' in an informal survey at the Cerebral Valley AI Conference. The result offers an unexpected perspective on the ChatGPT maker that has $100-plus valuation. The survey asked founders and investors which AI startup they would be willing to bet against, a question not typically raised so openly in Silicon Valley. AI search startup Perplexity received the most votes, followed by ChatGPT-maker OpenAI. Meanwhile, when the audience was asked whether they could invest in any private technology company, most people voted for the Claude maker Anthropic, while OpenAI took second place.According to a Business Insider report, independent journalist Eric Newcomer conducted the survey by gathering responses from more than 300 attendees before panels featuring other major AI companies, such as Anthropic and xAI. This shows that some industry professionals are becoming more cautious about the success of AI startups. Even with a lot of money going into AI, there is now some doubt about how well certain big companies in the field will do.OpenAI taking second place on the list may seem unexpected because it is often viewed as a consumer-focused leader in the AI space. However, its rapidly rising valuation and significant infrastructure costs have raised concerns for some investors. Even though Sam Altman has acknowledged the possibility of an AI bubble, OpenAI CEO rejected the idea that his company’s valuation is overstated during a recent conversation with investor Brad Gerstner.Gerstner asked Altman at the interview.Altman replied.Altman noted that interest in the company remains strong. In fact, both OpenAI and Perplexity were popular choices in another part of the survey that asked which companies respondents would be willing to bet on.Perplexity, which also offers an AI-powered search browser, is aiming to compete with Google, and being ranked first on the list is not unexpected.Perplexity has become a typical example in discussions about the possibility of an AI bubble, as it has raised frequent funding rounds and attracted strong investor interest at valuations reported to range from $14 billion to $50 billion, according to the report.When asked about the Cerebral Valley survey, Perplexity spokesperson Jesse Dwyer responded in an email:However, it's important to note that any informal, anonymous survey should be viewed cautiously. Yet, the results offer insight into private opinions, as many founders and investors discuss concerns about an AI bubble but rarely mention specific companies.Unlike public markets, private investors do not typically bet against startups, and openly criticising a company without clear justification is generally discouraged in Silicon Valley.
Article Summary: Chatgpt maker openai was voted among the startups with potential to 'fail' in an informal survey at the cerebral valley ai conference. The survey asked founders and investors which ai startup they would be willing to bet against. Ai search startup perplexity received the most votes, followed by chatgpt-maker openai.

Article Title: Row erupts after Elon Musk claims robots will ‘eliminate poverty, make everyone wealthy’: ‘Fantasy world sold by the richest man’
Article Text:
Elon Musk Watches In Shock As Trump Pats His Belly With MBS & Melania Walking Side By Side





Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered a bold view of the future, saying daily work could become optional within the next two decades as AI and robotics reshape daily life. Speaking at the US–Saudi Investment Forum, Musk said rapid advances in technology could make traditional jobs unnecessary for most people. “I do not know exactly what long-term means, perhaps 10 to 20 years,” he said. “My prediction is that work will be optional.”He compared future work to hobbies such as playing sports or video games, suggesting people may choose to work only if they enjoy it. According to Musk, people could still earn money, shop normally or even grow their own food.However, social media was very sceptical of such a hugely idealistic and optimistic idea, with users trolling Musk by comparing it to the film Wall-E. Meanwhile, left-wing X users argued that Musk’s vision would only ever be possible for the rich.Musk went a step further by suggesting that money itself may lose its importance if AI and robotics continue to improve. He said a future society might function without relying heavily on currency, although access to energy and raw materials would still set limits. He pointed again to Tesla’s Optimus humanoid robot, saying robots could become a larger industry than smartphones.The billionaire argued that use of advanced robots could help eliminate poverty by lowering the cost of labour and increasing productivity. “AI and humanoid robots will actually eliminate poverty,” Musk said, adding that many companies, not just Tesla, will eventually produce such machines.
Article Summary: Tesla ceo elon musk said daily work could become optional within the next two decades as ai and robotics reshape daily life. He compared future work to hobbies such as playing sports or video games, suggesting people may choose to work only if they enjoy it. However, social media was very sceptical of such a hugely idealistic and optimistic idea.

Article Title: 'Heavy debt, rising costs': UK’s largest pub group to sell around thousand sites; eyes deal worth 1 billion pounds
Article Text:
Stonegate Group, the UK's largest pub operator, is reportedly considering selling approximately 1,000 of its most profitable "platinum" pubs for an estimated £1 billion. This move aims to address the company's substantial £3 billion debt burden. The sale of these separately structured sites would not impact the rest of Stonegate's extensive estate.





Stonegate Group, the UK’s largest pub operator and owner of chains including Slug & Lettuce and Be At One, is reportedly considering the sale of around 1,000 sites in a deal potentially worth 1 billion pounds, Independent reported.The move comes as the group seeks to address an estimated 3 billion pounds in accumulated debts.According to Independent, the sites under consideration form a portfolio of the group’s most profitable pubs, often described as its “platinum” collection. These pubs are structured as a separate entity within Stonegate, allowing a sale without affecting the rest of its estate of 4,300 sites. Executives are consulting advisers on options, including selling the pubs in smaller groups rather than in a single transaction.A Stonegate spokesperson told The Sun that no pubs are at risk of closure and all sites will continue to operate under the Stonegate brand. Analysts note that many UK pub chains remain under pressure, with several, such as Oakman Inns & Restaurants, entering administration earlier this year due to elevated costs and reduced revenue.Stonegate’s financial difficulties date back to its 2019 merger with rival company Ei, which left the group heavily indebted just months before the Covid-19 lockdown severely impacted the hospitality sector.Attempts to sell some sites in previous years were unsuccessful, and the group instead refinanced the platinum pubs with a 638 million pounds loan from private equity firm Apollo. The end of a non-call period on this loan in January could allow Stonegate to pursue a potential sale, The Independent reported.Chief executive David McDowall, who joined the company from BrewDog in 2023, had outlined a “transformation plan” to return Stonegate to profitability. Despite these measures, the company posted a 214 million pounds loss in 2024.The wider UK hospitality industry too continues to face challenges from high operating costs, rising energy and food prices, increased national insurance contributions, and the ongoing impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on customer spending.
Article Summary: Stonegate group, the uk's largest pub operator, is reportedly considering the sale of around 1,000 sites in a deal potentially worth 1 billion pounds. The move comes as the group seeks to address an estimated 3 billion pounds in accumulated debts. The sale of these separately structured sites would not impact the rest of stonegate's extensive estate.

Article Title: Dubai Watch Week 2025 kicks off with spectacular innovations and rare timepieces
Article Text:
Dubai Watch Week 2025 showcases rare timepieces, immersive exhibits, limited editions, and interactive luxury watch experiences/Image: Instagram

A grand opening and record participation

Interactive experiences and educational highlights





Girard Perregaux offers a racing-inspired driving simulator, aligning with the spirit of its automotive-themed watches.

Van Cleef & Arpels combines poetic watch artistry with Middle Eastern cultural influences, merging craftsmanship and storytelling.

Bonhams hosts a public watch valuation booth, providing insights into vintage watch investment and appraisal.

Exclusive timepieces steal the spotlight





Mattar Bin Lahej x Octo Finissimo

Mattar Bin Lahej x Octo Finissimo/Image: Insatagram

“The future will be for those who can imagine, design, and implement it. The future does not wait, but it can be designed and built today.”

Louis Vuitton Escale Limited Edition

Louis Vuitton Escale Limited Edition/Image: Louis Vuitton

Norqain Wild One Meteorite Special Edition

Norqain Wild One Meteorite Special Edition/Image: Instagram

Audemars Piguet celebrates 150 years with the house of wonders





Clock Room, Gallery of Time, Mechanical Secrets, and Astronomical Observatory

Archival documents, rare complications, and contemporary designs tracing the evolution of watchmaking

A forward-looking Lab section highlighting innovation and collaboration





The 7th edition of Dubai Watch Week 2025 has launched in spectacular style at Burj Park, Dubai Mall, transforming the 200,000-square-foot venue into a playground for watch enthusiasts and collectors. Bringing together legendary maisons with centuries of heritage and daring independent creators, the event unites the full spectrum of horology under one roof. Day one dazzled visitors with rare limited editions, immersive installations, and interactive experiences, setting the tone for a festival that promises to redefine luxury watchmaking in the region and beyond.The event’s official inauguration featured speeches from Hind Seddiqi, Chief Marketing and Communications Officer at Seddiqi Holding and CEO of Dubai Watch Week, alongside Abdul Hamied Seddiqi, Chairman of Seddiqi Holding. Their remarks highlighted the event’s family heritage while signalling a forward-looking vision for the watch industry.This year, Dubai Watch Week has attracted over 90 brands, marking a 46% increase in participation compared to the last edition. Exhibitors range from historic watch houses with centuries of expertise to independent designers exploring innovative approaches. Unlike traditional luxury watch fairs, the festival’s layout integrates art installations, interactive displays, and communal learning experiences, creating a more immersive environment that encourages exploration beyond the watches themselves.Brands have introduced distinctive activations to engage visitors:A historic milestone occurred with the first-ever CEO roundtable, gathering industry leaders including Georges Kern (Breitling), Ilaria Resta (Audemars Piguet), Karl-Friedrich Scheufele (Chopard), and Julien Tornare (Hublot). The discussion offered attendees an unprecedented window into the strategies and challenges shaping the future of luxury watchmaking.Several limited-edition releases made a striking debut on day one:A 40mm titanium watch, only 70 pieces produced. The case, bracelet, and dial are engraved with Arabic calligraphy inspired by a quote from HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum:It houses the BVL 138 ultra-thin automatic movement with micro-rotor, featuring hand-finished Côtes de Genève, chamfering, and perlage.Two 40mm models, capped at 30 pieces each, feature turquoise and malachite dials with matching stone rings encircling the case. Platinum is used for lugs, bezel, crown, and caseback. The LFT023 automatic calibre includes a rose-gold micro-rotor, visible through the caseback. Crafting required meticulous hand-cutting and polishing to accommodate the unique properties of each stone, paired with textured Saffiano leather straps.The first Norqain watch to feature authentic iron meteorite, highlighting the natural Widmanstätten pattern unique to each dial. Encased in a 42mm burgundy Norteq carbon-fibre case, the watch contains the Norqain Manufacture Calibre NN20/1 by Kenissi, COSC-certified and visible through a sapphire crystal caseback.To commemorate its 150th anniversary, Audemars Piguet has brought its House of Wonders, a 1,000-square-metre travelling exhibition, to Dubai. Reimagining its 1875 headquarters, the experience includes:Visitors can also participate in masterclasses and a panel with the Dubai Future Foundation, emphasising the ongoing role of cooperation and innovation in shaping Swiss horology’s future.
Article Summary: Dubai watch week 2025 showcases rare timepieces, immersive exhibits, limited editions, and interactive luxury watch experiences. This year, dubai watch week has attracted over 90 brands, marking a 46% increase in participation compared to the last edition.

Article Title: Breaking: Abu Dhabi rolls out free 10GB SIM for all international passengers
Article Text:
Abu Dhabi ensures seamless arrivals with free 10GB SIM / AI Generated Image

10GB free SIM on arrival

Who Gets It? Every international traveler arriving at Zayed International Airport (AUH). You must be 18 years or older.



The Freebie: A whopping 10GB of high-speed data.



The Time Limit: The free 10GB is valid for the first 24 hours from activation. This gives you a full day to settle in, navigate, and communicate.



The Tech: You can often choose between a traditional physical SIM card or a modern, hassle-free eSIM , depending on your phone's capabilities.

Instant connection right after immigration

Clear Immigration: The free SIM service becomes available right after you complete your entry formalities.



Scan and Smile: The activation process is completely digital. You simply need to scan a designated QR code and complete a quick, secure connection using facial recognition technology.



Go! The digital self-activation means your line is live almost instantly.





Bonus tip for Etihad travelers

What to know next?





International travelers arriving at Zayed International Airport (AUH) will now receive a complimentary visitor SIM card loaded with 10GB of free data, courtesy of a new strategic partnership between Abu Dhabi Airports and telecom giant e&.The initiative was championed by Elena Sorlini, Managing Director and CEO at Abu Dhabi Airports, and Masood M. Sharif Mahmood, CEO of e& UAE, who both emphasized that the service is designed to deliver a seamless, digital-first experience, ensuring every visitor has instant connectivity from the moment they land in the capital.ing in Abu Dhabi just got a whole lot easier and a whole lot cheaper! Abu Dhabi Airports, in a brilliant move focused entirely on making your trip stress-free, has partnered with the telecom giant e& (formerly Etisalat) to offer every single international traveler a complimentary visitor SIM card.Here are the key details you need to know about the free data package:The best part? This free service is designed to be as seamless and fast as possible, perfectly aligning with Abu Dhabi Airport's reputation for world-class service (it’s been named the "Best Airport at Arrivals Globally" for three consecutive years).The process of getting connected is instantaneous, helping you avoid queues and saving you the headache of searching for a Wi-Fi signal after a long flight.How to get instantly connected:This immediate connectivity is crucial for a traveler. You can instantly access essential digital services like Google Maps to navigate, ride-hailing apps (like Careem or local taxis) to book your transport, and cashless payment apps to start your transactions without delay. It also allows immediate use of messaging apps to tell your family you’ve arrived safely and access destination guides, like the Abu Dhabi Pass, which offers special discounts.If you are flying into AUH with Etihad Airways, the free SIM card with 10GB of data is often bundled as part of the complimentary Abu Dhabi Pass. This pass is an extra benefit that gives you discounts (sometimes up to 15% off) on major city attractions and even includes free access to the Abu Dhabi Tourist Shuttle service.While 10GB for 24 hours is an amazing welcome, there are two crucial details you must keep in mind to ensure a perfect start to your trip: Remember, the 10GB clock starts ticking immediately. If you plan to stay longer than a day (which is likely!), you will need to purchase one of e&’s prepaid Visitor Line packages before the 24-hour free period expires. These plans offer varying amounts of data, call minutes, and longer validity periods.An important rule to remember when using any telecom service in the UAE is that local regulations generally do not permit Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) services. This means while you can use apps like WhatsApp, FaceTime, or Viber for chatting and sending media, the voice and video calling functions on these apps may be restricted. You'll need to purchase a paid package that includes local and international minutes for standard calling.
Article Summary: Abu dhabi ensures seamless arrivals with free 10gb sim. Every international traveler arriving at zayed international airport (auh) will now receive a complimentary visitor sim card loaded with 10gb of free data. The activation process is completely digital.

Article Title: UAE Yellow Friday mega-sale begins with up to 90% discounts and meals from Dh1
Article Text:
UAE shoppers rush as Yellow Friday discounts explode / AI Generated Image



The yellow friday mega-sale 2025

The 90% off secret





The 90% Flash Deal Window: The highest discount of 90% off is available during the lightning-fast sales on noon Minutes. You must be fast to catch these limited-stock deals on personal care and beauty items.



Electronics Steals: This is the easiest way to save hundreds or thousands of Dirhams.



Laptops are available starting from just Dhs699.

Mobiles start from a mere Dhs199.

You can grab Headphones and Speakers for as little as Dhs49.

Gaming essentials are discounted by up to 60% off.



Home Overhaul: Need new appliances or furniture? You can find deals up to 70% off on major home items and kitchen appliances, drastically cutting the cost of upgrading your living space.

Meals and groceries for Dh1

Restaurant / Item Regular Price Yellow Friday Price Instant Saving Hardee's Cheeseburger Dh10 Dh1 90% Off Popeyes 2pc Chicken Box Dh36 Dh5 86% Off Dunkin' Classic Donuts Dh8 Dh4 50% Off Pizza Hut Varies 50% Off on selected items Major Savings

Download the noon App: The absolute fastest way to access deals is by using the official noon mobile application. Deals are often launched as real-time alerts. Turn on your push notifications to get an instant jump on the 90% off flash deals before they appear on the website.



Go noon One: To immediately multiply your savings, sign up for the noon One membership (it often has a free trial). This instantly gives you unlimited free delivery on all orders, including those Dh1 food orders, meaning you pay nothing extra to get your deals delivered quickly.



Use Filters and Wish Lists: Don't waste time scrolling when the sale starts. Create a wish list now for the items you want. When the deals go live, use the app's filters to search by price range or discount percentage instantly, allowing you to bypass browsing and head straight to the biggest savings.

Pay later, get free delivery

Flexible Payments: Take advantage of 'Buy Now, Pay Later' through partners like Tabby and Tamara. You can also use 0% interest installment plans with several banks.



Get Free Delivery: If you are a noon One member, you automatically get FREE delivery on all your orders, including the Dh1 food deals.



Cashback and Bank Offers: Look out for extra savings from your bank. Emirates NBD cardholders get exclusive additional discounts, and new users can often stack up 10% cashback on their very first order.



15-Minute Delivery: The noon Minutes service ensures your essentials, from groceries to small electronics, arrive in 15 minutes or less, perfect for those must-have flash deals.

Conclusion







The UAE's biggest sale of the year is officially here. noon.com has launched its massive Yellow Friday Sale, offering the kind of discounts that make Christmas shopping cheap and weeknight dinners easier. Running for 11 straight days, from November 20th to November 30th, this event is your best chance to buy everything you need at rock-bottom prices. The biggest takeaway for any smart shopper is simple: expect savings up to 90% off and ready-made meals starting from just Dh1.The noon Yellow Friday Mega-Sale is the largest annual shopping event across the Middle East, running for eleven straight days from November 20th to November 30th in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt. This sale is designed to give the common shopper maximum value, with overall discounts reaching up to 80% off, and limited-stock flash deals on the noon Minutes platform slashing prices by an incredible 90% off.Savvy shoppers should focus on securing major electronics early, where deals include laptops starting from Dhs699, mobile phones from Dhs199, and up to 60% off on gaming essentials. Furthermore, the sale extends deep into home and lifestyle needs, with major appliances, furniture, and bedding seeing significant price drops between 40% and 70% off.Beyond the headline discounts, the Yellow Friday Sale offers truly exceptional everyday value, particularly through the noon Food platform, where popular fast-food items (such as Hardee's Cheeseburgers) are available starting from just Dh1. Groceries and household essentials are also heavily discounted by up to 80% off, with many essential products priced at only Dh1. To enhance convenience, the noon Minutes service guarantees ultra-fast delivery in 15 minutes or less.The sale is also financially flexible: shoppers can utilize 'Buy Now, Pay Later' options through partners like Tabby, and noon One members secure free delivery on all orders across the entire marketplace, making these amazing deals even cheaper to acquire.While the whole site offers up to 80% off, the real savings are found in the flash deals and key categories. This is how you score 90% off:This is the most direct savings for the common man: getting food for the price of water. The noon Food platform has cut prices drastically, making it cheaper to order in than to shop and cook.Beyond meals, noon Minutes offers snacks, drinks, and essential household supplies starting from just Dh1, with delivery so fast the food is still hot. Here are the three essential steps to guarantee you snag the best offers:You don't need cash up front to grab these deals, and you don't have to wait days for shipping. noon has added several features to make your spending easier and cheaper:Noon bringing ultra-low meal pricing to its Yellow Friday list transforms a tech-led shopping event into an everyday consumer win: cheaper lunches and family treats throughout the sale window. For shoppers, it’s a low-risk way to try Noon Food’s platform; for restaurants it’s a high-volume promotional play in a crowded holiday period. The combination of marketplace-wide discounts plus food flash deals makes this sale one of the season’s most consumer-friendly pushes.
Article Summary: The noon yellow friday mega-sale is the largest annual shopping event across the middle east. Running for 11 straight days, from november 20th to november 30th, this event is your best chance to buy everything you need at rock-bottom prices. Expect savings up to 90% off and ready-made meals starting from just dh1.

Article Title: UAE launches economic programme to attract 1,000 global trade companies and boost emirati exports
Article Text:
Sheikh Mohammed launches UAE programme to attract 1,000 global trade companies and expand exports/Image: X

A new programme targeting the world’s top trading firms





Digital gateway to connect UAE exporters with global markets





Reinforcing the UAE’s position in global trade routes





Foreign trade performance reaches new heights









The UAE has introduced a new international economic programme designed to attract the world’s leading trading companies, expand access for local exporters, and reinforce the country’s role as a central hub in global commerce. The initiative comes as the nation records strong foreign-trade growth and rising service-export activity.The UAE announced the launch of an international economic programme aimed at bringing 1,000 of the world’s top companies specialising in international trade into the country. The initiative was revealed on Thursday by His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, the UAE’s Vice President, Prime Minister, and Ruler of Dubai, through a statement on his X account.In his message, Sheikh Mohammed explained that the programme is designed to strengthen the UAE’s global standing in foreign trade and expand the country’s economic partnerships. The plan specifically focuses on attracting high-performing international trade firms that can integrate into the UAE’s commercial ecosystem and stimulate investment and export activity.A core component of the programme is the creation of a digital gateway that will link thousands of UAE exporting companies directly to markets worldwide.This platform is intended to widen international access for UAE-based producers and service providers, offering new channels through which they can promote and distribute their goods.Sheikh Mohammed emphasised that this gateway is expected to generate greater opportunities for UAE exporters by helping them enter new markets and expand their presence on global trade routes. The initiative aims not only to support existing exporters but also to encourage more companies within the UAE to engage in cross-border trade.In outlining the programme, Sheikh Mohammed stated that these efforts collectively reinforce the UAE’s role as an important hub on international trade routes. The announcements reflect the country’s ongoing strategy to position itself as an advanced centre for trade facilitation, logistics, and globally integrated commerce.The initiative aligns with the UAE’s long-term economic direction, which involves cultivating international partnerships, investing in digital trade tools, and increasing the contribution of exports, both goods and services, to the overall economy.The country’s trade performance in 2024 set the backdrop for the new programme’s launch. The UAE recorded Dh5.23 trillion in foreign trade during the year, representing a 49% increase from Dh3.5 trillion (USD 949 billion) in 2021. This growth highlights the strong momentum in the UAE’s trading activity and the expanding scale of its global commercial relationships.Service exports also showed notable strength. In 2024, they reached Dh650 billion, a figure that underscores the increasing importance of non-goods trade. Within this category, digital services accounted for Dh191 billion, representing 30% of all service exports. These numbers point to the rising role of technology-driven sectors in the UAE’s trade profile.
Article Summary: Sheikh mohammed launches uae programme to attract 1,000 global trade companies and expand exports. The initiative comes as the nation records strong foreign-trade growth and rising service-export activity. A core component of the programme is the creation of a digital gateway that will link thousands of uae exporting companies directly to markets worldwide.

Article Title: Global icon Priyanka Chopra is coming to Abu Dhabi this December
Article Text:
Priyanka brings global star power to Abu Dhabi Bridge summit / Image source: File

Priyanka Chopra Jonas: The world’s most successful south asian icon

BRIDGE Summit 2025

Dates & Location: December 8–10, 2025, at the ADNEC Centre in Abu Dhabi.



Expected Attendance: Over 60,000 participants are anticipated.



Program Scope: The event will feature over 400 global speakers and 300 exhibitors spread across 1.65 million square feet of space.



Star-studded lineup

Idris Elba: The acclaimed actor, filmmaker, DJ ("Big Driis"), and philanthropist.



Gary Vaynerchuk: CEO of VaynerMedia and famed entrepreneur.



Alexis Ohanian: Founder of Seven Seven Six and co-founder of Reddit.



Sir Martin Sorrell: Founder and Executive Chairman of S4 Capital.



Looking ahead





Global star Priyanka Chopra Jonas will be among the headline speakers and guests at the BRIDGE Summit 2025, taking place at the ADNEC Centre, Abu Dhabi, from December 8-10, 2025. The summit organisers list her as a featured participant and are promoting opportunities for attendees to meet speakers at the event.If you want to see her in person, register for BRIDGE through the official summit channels, organisers are asking delegates and visitors to register early because the event hosts hundreds of international speakers and limited-ticket sessions (some appearances are by invitation or reserved for summit delegates). Official BRIDGE social posts and the event page provide the registration links and session schedulesAfter making headlines in India with her viral all-white appearance at SS Rajamouli’s Varanasi launch event, Priyanka Chopra Jonas is now set to bring her global star power to the UAE. Fresh off the buzz of her graceful, namaste-filled public appearance in Hyderabad, the Hollywood-Bollywood icon will travel to Abu Dhabi this December as a headline speaker at the BRIDGE Summit, giving UAE fans a rare chance to see her in person.Priyanka Chopra Jonas is one of India's most successful cultural exports, known for her ability to navigate multiple worlds with seamless authority. Her career established her as Bollywood royalty, with a filmography that includes award-winning roles in movies like Fashion, Barfi!, Mary Kom, and Bajirao Mastani.Each performance showcased her range and undeniable star wattage.When the scope of Bollywood no longer matched her ambition, she turned West, achieving a major breakout role in the hit series Quantico. This move made her a household name in the US and cemented her status as a rare cultural crossover icon. Today, she uses her platform to champion critical issues like equality, women's rights, and global representation, appealing to a massive cross-industry audience.The event bringing this global star to the Middle East is the BRIDGE Summit 2025, launched by the UAE National Media Office (NMO). It is billed as the world's largest debut media event, designed to be a massive marketplace for ideas, deals, and partnerships across the global media, content, and entertainment industries.The summit's scale is immense:The summit is structured around seven crucial content tracks that map the industry's future: Media, Creator Economy, Music, Gaming, Technology, Marketing, and Picture.Priyanka Chopra Jonas will contribute more than just star value; she brings her credibility and influence as a powerful global role model. Attendees can expect her to discuss fearless reinvention, the intersection of culture and creativity, and how to champion diverse voices in the global content economy.She is joined by an elite roster of global figures, confirming the summit's status as a major international event:By gathering these policymakers, creative founders, and global executives, the BRIDGE Summit aims to be an open laboratory where dialogue is translated into action, establishing new standards for sustainable growth and cross-cultural collaboration across the globe.Priyanka Chopra Jonas’s upcoming visit adds yet another high-profile moment to the UAE’s rapidly expanding cultural calendar. From her viral appearance in India to her much-anticipated presence in Abu Dhabi, the momentum around her global journey continues to grow.As fans, industry leaders and creatives prepare to gather at the BRIDGE Summit, one thing is certain, Priyanka’s arrival won’t just be an appearance, it will be an event. And for the UAE, it’s a reminder of its rising stature as a global destination where the world’s biggest icons choose to connect, inspire and lead.
Article Summary: Priyanka brings global star power to abu dhabi bridge summit. The event will feature over 400 global speakers and 300 exhibitors spread across 1.65 million square feet of space. The summit organisers list her as a featured participant and are promoting opportunities for attendees to meet speakers at the event.
